To the Editor: I would like to commend the Practical Traveler column, ''High Tech Helps Disabled Skiers'' (Nov. 14). The realm of adaptive sport and recreation truly deserves attention. The capacity of adaptive activities to affect the lives of participants shows in their smiles.

I'd like to point out an oversight, however. Although the picture with the column shows a skier with a disability in Crested Butte, Colo., the article did not mention the Crested Butte Adaptive Sports Center, at the base of the ski area, of which I am director. The center provides thousands of adaptive ski lessons in winter and a full range of adventure activities in summer -- rafting, canoeing, mountain biking and climbing. The center can be reached at Post Office Box 1639, Crested Butte, Colo. 81224, (970) 349-2296, or at www.adaptivesports.org.
